text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to advise the solicitor that *Palmer v R* and *Beckford v R* are not binding domestic UK precedent because they are not UK-based. The candidate answer explicitly cites and relies upon *Beckford v R* [1988] AC 130 (PC Jamaica) and *Palmer v R* [1971] AC 814 (PC) as supporting authority for the principle that an honest but mistaken belief is sufficient for self-defence. The response fails to advise that these Privy Council cases are not binding domestic UK precedent (though persuasive), thus failing to satisfy the specific negative requirement of the rubric criterion.", "criterion_id": "bbfa06d0-1d7b-41af-bb76-fa659eee9bd5"}
